course.subject: LANG
course.name: English Language for University Studies
course.description: This course aims for students in their first year of study and will develop students’ spoken and written language proficiency. The course also introduces academic literacy  skills common to all disciplines. Students will learn to evaluate others’ opinions, develop strong arguments and communicate those arguments effectively in written and spoken English. In addition to traditional academic writing, the  course includes elements of academic communication that go beyond the text level  to incorporate academic communication that includes text and audio. They will also build skills and habits for self-directed learning at university.
course.prerequisites: (Level 3 in HKDSE English Language with all papers at or above level 3) OR (Level 4 in HKDSE English Language) OR (Level 5 in HKDSE English Language with some papers but not all at or above level 4) OR (Overall bandscore of 6.0 in IELTS) OR (Overall bandscore of 6.5 in IELTS with some but not all subscores at or above 6.0) OR equivalence of the above

reviews.author: yan12345
reviews.comment_content:
Specking Task 1 (25%)— Discussion Skills
Assessment
Speaking Task 2 (20%)— Short Speech (2.5-3min)
Writing Task (35%)— Short Essay (800words)
Self-Directed Learning (SDL) Assessment (20%)— Graded on completion
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a very friendly professor. Although he will randomly ask questions during class, it doesn't matter if you don't know how to answer. The class atmosphere is very good and we often provide time for group discussions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Speaking Task 1 (ST1) - 25%
I got one Advanced/ Competent and two Advanced.
Writing Task (WT) - 35%
I got one Advanced/ Competent and two Advanced.
Speaking Task 2 (ST2) - 20%
I got one Advanced/ Competent and one Exceptional/ Advanced.

The final grade was A-.
reviews.comment_workload: The professor will provide us with some lesson times to finish the required assignments and remind us of the due date. They often finish class early.

reviews.author: Cynthia__1
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1 – Language and Learning at University
• Develop effective language and learning habits and practices
• Evaluate useful resources and learning strategies
• Select appropriate spoken and written language and style for the audience and task
Unit 2 – Exploring the future
• Develop constructive discussion skills
• Develop and support central ideas and theses
• Utilise multiple perspectives in academic discussions
Unit 3 - Exploring future problems and solutions
• Exploring different perspectives in writing
• Produce coherent texts
• Paraphrase and summarise sources
• Select appropriate language and style for academic writing
• Produce organised and coherent short speeches
• Use appropriate vocal strategies
reviews.comment_teaching: Doreen is friendly and supportive. She used to encourage student s to engage more in class.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it is fair grade, the grading depends on your efforts.
reviews.comment_workload: Normal workload and easy to afford.

reviews.author: RCzzzz
reviews.comment_content: Boring and useless but relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.comment_teaching: Important to meet a good professor who teaches well and gives good grades.
reviews.comment_grading: Although I did not do well on the first speaking task 1, I performed better in the rest of the tasks so that I got an A range in the end. Once again, choosing a good professor is super important.
reviews.comment_workload: Lighter than expected (take reference from other comments). Yet, the presentation date of second speaking task is near to the end of the semester, which has other deadlines of other courses. So, please manage your time well.

reviews.author: Soysauceee
reviews.title: Hell. Run.
reviews.comment_content: Others have said in their review, I am not gonna elaborate here.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring tone, boring content. Christie usually reads all of her powerpoint aloud and give us some 5 to 10 minutes practice time with our group mates. She would stops by and listen to our conversation , one time she just stood there for 10 minutes. Hell for everyone. Also she is not very friendly, one time I asked her about some course outline and homework, she didn't even bother to listen and just told me to read the guidelines. For hell's sake, I reached for her help because my questions uint mentioned in the guidelines!
reviews.comment_grading: Poor grading. I got a C+ but I didn't appeal. I know she doesn't like me so I didn't bother too. All of my SDLs and WT are done before deadlines, but most of them got competent/emerging , while others got better grades than me. I guess I am just not her favs.
reviews.comment_workload: Same as other review.

reviews.author: Ch1785866430
reviews.title: 似中學英文堂。。。
reviews.comment_content:
整體教嘅都係點樣improve reading/writing/speaking skill
感覺同中學分別不大 只不過唔教grammar
係幾無聊 不過有d部分ok有用 整體作用不大
要做兩個presentation（in front of半班同學+要背稿 否則預左低分）
reviews.comment_teaching:
lang堂係我yr1第一個sem最有上堂氛圍嘅堂
Eugene好nice 會記得每個同學嘅名 然後上堂會點名答問題（親身經歷：請不要和他有視線交流）
佢上堂嘅時候俾好多discussion時間 然後佢會行黎行去 所以有咩唔明可以等佢行到過黎嘅時候問（令我呢個社恐人士都幾乎每堂會問問題）
佢好樂意回答大家嘅問題 幾乎所有同學都問過問題
因為大家都坐定一個位 所以周圍一齊坐嘅會熟 好似返左中學上英文堂咁（仲係可以隨便吹水/做自己野嘅英文堂）都幾chill下
reviews.comment_grading:
主要計分係2 Speaking Task + 1 writing
要額外去cle網站睇分
Eugene每堂都會點名 但係好似只計過1次attendance分

Competent Advanced Competent

Writing Task (WT) - 35%
Advanced Advanced Advanced

Speaking Task 2 (ST2) - 20%
Competent Advanced

SDL - Tasks and Elective - 15%
4 1

SDL - Reflective Task (RT) - 5%
1

最後A grade
reviews.comment_workload:
唔算好多野做 2 Speaking Task + 2 writing +1 elective
到後期算隔個禮拜有功課

reviews.comment_content: no comment as i skipped some of the lesson and that it doesn’t make a difference

reviews.author: chan chan chan
reviews.comment_content: Just secondary school stuff
reviews.comment_teaching: Teacher is nice and passionate but the content is just still boring and basic
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you have the attendance, join all the speaking tests and submit all the dam writings, the grade won't be bad, even if the the quality of your work is not that great
reviews.comment_workload:
2 Speaking Task, 1st one is group discussion+1:30 minutes speech, 2nd one is 3 minutes speech

1 Writing Task, 800 words academic essay about future global issues

4 SDL Tasks:
1. Group discussion recording
2. Submit a body paragraph
3. Submit a revised body paragraph using feedback from ChatGPT
4. Submit an essay outline generated by ChatGPT

Electives:
Just do Elective 3, you only need to do MC and matchings. Avoid other electives
Elective E1 - Improving pronunciation
Elective E2 - Expanding vocabulary
Elective E3 - Organizing paragraphs
Elective E4 - Developing confidence in speaking at university

Reflective Task:
300-400 words reflection with evidence and examples

reviews.author: LKcubing
reviews.comment_content: Content is not very challenging. You will learn how to research, make references, and just English writing and presentation in general. there is very little "new" stuff to learn actually
reviews.comment_teaching: There really is not much to teach and lecturer just skim through the word docs mostly just ask us to have discussion. Half of the times he just let us go early.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is pretty bad. I think my English is pretty good but my grade is not. Attendance is graded. Also some self learning tasks which I missed.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is higher than most 3 credit courses but there is no final exam. There is 3 annotated bibliographies (abt 1000 words total), synthesis paper (300 words), e-magazine (1000 words) and you need to write more if your groupmates are not doing enough. Also need 2 reflections (abt 500 words total). Overall it is fine I guess

reviews.author: Isaac4862
reviews.comment_content: A beginner-level course that guides students in adapting to university-level English instruction. This course focuses on training college students' basic essay writing skills and academic speaking and discussion abilities by developing group speaking and writing tasks related to the latest global issues in technology, environment, social sciences, and other fields. I believe that the course places a moderate emphasis on English proficiency, with a greater emphasis on cultivating students' ability to gather information for research. This is similar to the previous social issue component of the English Language subject in the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (DSE) examinations and also responds to the need for university general education to cultivate students' critical thinking skills and humanistic concerns.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer graduated from the English Department of the University of Hong Kong and possesses advanced English language proficiency. Her English pronunciation closely resembles that of native British speakers. She is capable of providing students with clear instructions to complete classroom tasks. However, her teaching style tends to be dull and fails to effectively cater to students' limited attention spans. Nevertheless, the lecturer shows concern for students' needs and is able to clearly point out areas where students' English proficiency is lacking.
reviews.comment_grading: I did not fulfill my responsibilities as a student and failed to complete assignments on time, resulting in a significant reduction in my scores. However, relying on the English foundation I built during my secondary school years, I managed to barely achieve a C+ grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Consistently, the instructor provided students with a reasonable amount of time to complete assignments. The work done met the requirements of the course.

reviews.author: Retire123
reviews.comment_content: The content lacked depth. I feel lost and uncertain about how to enhance my presentation skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: I cannot learn new things even if I listened to the lesson. The teaching approach failed to create a positive and stimulating learning environment.
reviews.comment_grading: The feedback provided on assignments and exams was often vague and unhelpful. I finished all the assignments seriously and tried my best in the presentations and got an C-.
reviews.comment_workload: An essay, some presentations. It often felt like a race to complete tasks rather than an opportunity to truly absorb and apply what I learnt.

reviews.author: Michael G
reviews.title: Thomas CHAN is a great teacher and a kind GRADE GIVER!
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers systemic requirements and certain techniques of self-presentation, group discussion and essay production.
It mainly focuses on two dimensions from spoken language to written language.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Thomas CHAN's teaching is quite entertaining and informative. In the first 10 minutes, he always leaves two interesting (or not) questions for our discussing in pairs and demonstrating later before class.
Besides, he basically follows the syllabus but choose certain topic (/ part) in each single lecture material. He is kind and humorous, every feedback is worthy for re-thinking and improving.
reviews.comment_grading:
Thomas CHAN is not a GRADE KILLER!!
(ANYWAY Why can't I find his name in instructor list?!!)
My speaking task 1 was not that good (honestly bad), I only got 1 Advanced/Competent and 2 Competent (similarly to 3.5x1 and 3x2?).
And the following speaking task 2 and writing task is majorly Advanced with 1 Advanced/Competent and 1 Exceptional/Advanced.
In this case, I eventually get an A, which is really beyond   my expectations!! So I find Thomas surely a kind GRADE GIVER!
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not light btw.
Besides two speaking tasks and one writing task, several minor tasks in or after class.
Attendance is taken as well (that's why I cannot have lunch every Tue and Thur, I was really starving......)
I supposed it the most time-killing course except for Honor courses.

the tutor is quite interesting lol

got A- without much workload

so just enjoy your class

reviews.author: 黑色劍士
reviews.comment_content:
原materials冇咩用
Take attendance但係attendance唔計分

會有課外影片等等，有啲都幾鍾意睇

reviews.comment_workload: 基本asm

reviews.author: AsiaMIT
reviews.comment_content: I don’t know what is useful except teaching u the tone in academic  writing like using passive form don’t use “own opinion”, to be objective . Overall speaking is blow water course
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is fine
好人 and pretty talkative
Interactive and will remember you
Not bad and u can chill in the class
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fine, If ur English is not really bad, I didn’t pay lots of effort and turns out a B which is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost 0 workload
2 speaking task and 1 writing task
You don’t have to spend a lot of time on this course

reviews.author: cylaiaz
reviews.comment_content:
This course focuses on speaking and writing. Lecture notes were provided but some content in the notes was outdated. I only found some parts of the notes useful. It would be great if you could use the skills in the notes when completing the assignment to get higher marks. Attendance was not graded but Doreen took attendance every lecture.

Syllabus:
U1L1 - Language learning at university - Course Introduction
U1L2 - Learning at university
U1L3 - Language learning at university
U1L4 - Using appropriate language style

U2L1 - Academic discussions - introduction
U2L2 - Academic discussions - introduction continue
U2L3 - Practicing academic discussions (No classroom lesson)
U2L4 - Developing ideas & perspectives
U2L5 - Developing ideas & perspectives continue
U2L6 - Feedback sharing & Participating in academic discussions

U3L1 - Exploring different problems
U3L2 - Paragraph development
U3L3 - Substance through paraphrasing and summaries
U3L4 - Producing coherent texts
U3L5 - Producing coherent texts & Using appropriate written language
U3L6 - Using appropriate language and style
U3L7 - Using appropriate language and style continue
U3L8 - Preparing and organising short speeches
U3L9 - Using voice to engage an audience

Unit 2 focuses on the academic discussion and how to prepare for speaking task 1. In unit 3, the L1 to L7 focus on essay writing (for writing task 1) and L8 to L9 focus on presentation (for speaking task 2).
reviews.comment_teaching: Doreen is nice and friendly. She allowed us to go earlier if she finished teaching the lecture notes. She understood that we might have many assignments from other courses, so she did not give us extra work other than what was provided in the Canvas. She sometimes prepared PowerPoint for lectures as she thought the lecture notes given were not useful. Overall, her teaching is good.
reviews.comment_grading: Although marking schemes for all tasks were provided, I thought they were not very clear. Sometimes I thought I did what was stated in the marking schemes but I got a low mark eventually. Anyway, I tried my best to get higher marks in each task and finally get A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Not heavy compared to other courses. There were some self-directed tasks and a reflective essay, but they were graded on completion only.

reviews.author: Taehyung
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1 - Language and Learning at University
*   Develop effective language and learning habits and practices
*   Evaluate useful resources and learning strategies
*   Select appropriate spoken and written language and style for the audience and task
Unit 2 - Exploring the future
*   Develop constructive discussion skills
*   Develop and support central ideas and theses
*   Utilise multiple perspectives in academic discussions
Unit 3 - Exploring future problems and solutions
*   Exploring different perspectives in writing
*   Produce coherent texts
*   Paraphrase and summarise sources
*   Select appropriate language and style for academic writing
*   Produce organised and coherent short speeches
*   Use appropriate vocal strategies

Practical: A. You can learn how to use ChatGPT correctly during the tutorials and when you are doing assignments. Focus on speaking and writing only, which are useful for afterwards university study life.

Interesting: A-. Compared to HKDSE English, this course is more fun. You can put more imagination into the theme as it is about the future instead of memorising DSE tactics. However, the tutorials are a little boring although interactive, it doesn’t matter if you skip a few lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching mode & material: A+. Very interactive. Ask questions that can let you think deeper and develop your confidence on speaking. Some content of the PowerPoint slides can help you score higher at your assignments.

Personality: A++. Remember everyone’s name very fast. A nice and friendly professor. Before each speaking task, he initiatively did consultations with each group or individual. Plus, he sent a music recommendation email to the students every week, with some encouraging words and also the pictures of his cat Mara.

Accent: A. Very fluent British accent.
reviews.comment_grading:
Speaking Task 1: 16/25
-SL Part 1 : Advanced (4/5)
-SL Part 2: Competent (3/5)
-IN: Competent (9/15)

Writing Task: 26/35
-WL: Competent (6/10)
-CO: Advanced (8/10)
-SU: Advanced (12/15)

Speaking Task 2: 16/20
-SL: Advanced (8/10)
-CO: Advanced (8/10)


SDL Tasks (Graded on completion): 12/12

SDL Elective (Graded on completion): 3/3

Reflective Task (Graded on completion): 5/5

Attendance is taken, but not counted into the total mark.
Total: 78/100
Grade: B
For reference: I got level 4 (4544) in DSE English

I expected B+ or above… and I think he give mark a little strange.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 main assignments only and a few small non-graded assignments. Recommend you not to memorise the speech of your speaking assignments. I did it, which wasted quite a lot of time.

reviews.author: mmmmmmmmmm
reviews.comment_content: This course focuses on basic spoken and written English skills you (probably) need to use in university. It teaches you to get your ideas from thoughts into words in a structured and organized manner, which can be easily understood by the audience. It is quite basic as it does not go over a lot of new topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Derek's teaching is engaging and enjoyable. He engages the class in activities to get his points across clearer, and has an interactive approach to teaching which I quite like. He gives feedback on your performance in assignments in class, and really tries to help you improve your English skills which is very nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Speaking Task 1 (Discussion) = 25%
Writing Task (Short Essay) = 35%
Speaking Task 2 (Short Speech/Monologue) = 20%
SDL (Self-Directed Learning) & Activities = 20%

Me:
ST1 (25%): All Advanced
WT  (35%): All Advanced/Competent
ST2 (20%): Advanced/Exceptional, Exceptional

Final Grade: A-

I was pleasantly surprised by my final grade as I expected a B-range from the grading of my assignments. However, it is to be noted that there was only a few students in my class who achieved Exceptional/Advanced or Exceptional grades at all, so it is likely that the grading was a bit strict.

I think that the grading is fair, not overly strict nor too generous. I believe that a good grade is achievable if you are confident in your English skills, and prepare sufficiently for your assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: There is not much workload. Technically you do not even have to prepare for the speaking tasks if you dare to. Considering that there are basically only 3 assignments you need to focus on, the workload is quite manageable as long as you prepare ahead of time. Having no midterms and finals is a huge plus, granting you more time to focus on your other subjects during those periods.

reviews.author: 呂黃幣夏（科大）
reviews.title: CLE Unique Grading System
reviews.comment_content:
Conclusion First: Useless, I learnt less from the syllabus. Better to spend time on other courses if you want to have a good grade.

4 Task that determine your grade most:
- Speaking Task 1(25%, in class)
- Writing Task(35%, hand in doc format, just like a homework)
- Speaking Task 2(20%, in class)
- Reflective Task(5%, just like a homework)

SDL task and Elective(15%)
- Elective: choose one elective and self study on the materials they provided, then finish quizzes yourself.
- SDL task means Homework

There are three main Units, targeting for the most three important task. Teaching skills that you might need for the tasks.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great teacher that catches your eyeball during the whole lesson. Most of the time spent for sharing own thoughts to people sit next to you/ group discussion. Focus most on speaking, than writing.
Best lecturer I met in HKUST.
reviews.comment_grading:
It has five level of grading.
Entering<Emerging<Competent<Advanced<Expectational

Myself:
ST1: Advanced/Competent;Competent;Competent/Emerging
WT:
Competent;Advanced/Competent;Competent
ST2:
Advanced/Competent;Advanced/Competent
Letter Grade:B(Thanks God!)

Why I will say "CLE Unique Grading System"?

I know someone is in different class, they have better marks on their task, but turns out C range.

Let's do a case study:
Student A: 7X%, normal/kind grading lecturer
Student B: 6X%, killer lecturer
This year they both get B grade

Student C: 6X%, normal/kind grading lecturer
He gets C range lmao, although he had same marks as Student B.

Conclusion: Don't spend your valuable time to try to get good grade in this course(If you think your English is not good). You never know what grade you will get in this CLE Unique Grading System.
P.S. I heard people said Kin Tang is killer
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say less.
You can use ChatGPT as assistance. But beware of the rules on using such kind of GenAI (The dept. also encourage you to use)

If you want to know more, comment below!

reviews.author: simon fung
reviews.title: Good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Language
Development
a. select language appropriate for the audience, context and
purpose; for spoken and written contexts
b. express complex ideas precisely with range and
complexity in vocabulary and sentence structures; and
develop clear pronunciation.
c. elaborate, substantiate, and organize logical ideas into
clear central points/theses and perspectives in speaking
and writing.
d. interact with others’ ideas to contribute and
communicate in group contexts.
e. analyse different audiences for different purposes, and
apply strategies to inform, interest, and persuade an
audience.
Academic Literacy f. critique ideas, analyse problems, evaluate solutions, and
consider multiple perspectives in speaking and writing.
g. find, evaluate, and use appropriate sources and citations
to support ideas; integrate ideas from multiple sources to
build central ideas/theses, and paraphrase sources
effectively.
Lifelong Learning h. apply learning strategies including goal setting, evaluating
learning strategies and resources, self-reflection to
become an effective learner.
(Language Form and Accuracy) Written Language (WL) and Spoken Language (SL) -
including selecting language appropriate for the audience, context, and purpose;
expressing ideas appropriately with range and complexity in vocabulary and sentence
structures; recognizing errors; proofreading and editing skills; and developing clear
pronunciation.
(Language Meaning) Substance (SU) and Coherence (CO) – including strategies for
elaborating, substantiating, and organizing ideas logically in speaking and writing.
(Language Use) Interaction (IN) – including strategies to keep a discussion going and
move it forwards constructively.
(Lifelong Learning) Being an Effective Learner (EL) – including proactive practices such as
goal setting, identifying language strengths and weaknesses, evaluating learning
strategies and resources, self-reflection, and seeking, giving, and acting on feedback.
reviews.comment_teaching: Really good,she is funny all the time.
reviews.comment_grading: You will get B if you treat this English course like HKDSE English. Remember to review your piece of writing to see if it fits the requirements or else you will end up with C or D.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 weeks for 1 assignment.

reviews.author: SBMstudent
reviews.title: Fair Grading
reviews.comment_content:
All your tasks is surrounded to a topic all "About the Future"

You have to complete 1 elective + 4 SDL + 1 reflection task + 2 Speaking tasks and 1 writing task.

Content is not important, everyone do the same thing.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Shen Chi is friendly and is willing to answer your questions without any punishment so she is a good lecturer.  

However, everyone knows that English lessons are almost useless for learning English, so don't expect too much.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair Grading but strict marking.
If you aim at B range then Shen Chi is good.

SP1(25%): Straight Advanced/Competent -> 17.5/25
WT1(35%): Exceptional/Advanced, Advanced, exceptional/advanced -> 30/35
SP2 (20%): Advanced/Advanced -> 16/20
Other tasks that are graded on completion are finished, which is free 20 marks.

Overall 83.5/100 A-, one thing I can sure is that my grade could be better if I had been in the other class.

Shen Chi never gives you Exceptional grading, and I think the maximum rating in speaking task is Advanced (asked my classmates and none of them got exceptional/advanced in Speaking tasks).

Think twice if you aim for A range, there are better choices for getting A but it's the best option for those who aim at B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost no workload, just a bit busy at the end of the semester.

reviews.author: Chad Gandalf
reviews.title: basically, a waste of time
reviews.comment_content:
It's mostly speaking with some writing. Plus, you are expected to talk every lesson so if you're an extrovert, you're gonna love it (probably), but if you're an introvert, sorry but you have to engage with others anyway.
**
Assignments:
(1) 4 SDL Tasks (incl. a group discussion, in class writing, revising the writing and an essay outline generated by ChatGPT)
(2) One SDL elective
(3) Speaking Task 1 (group interaction)
(4) Writing Task (academic essay)
(5) Speaking Task 2 (speech)
(6) Reflective Task
**
Boring, boring classes. Attendance doesn't count towards your course grade tho, so it's almost optional.
Fairly high usage of GenAI in this course, but honestly, I don't actually find it useful or helpful.
Learning how to do referencing and write thesis statement is useful, but other than that, I don't really know what I've learnt. So basically, a boring course that I don't like at all, but that's just my two cents.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is actually not bad, but it doesn't help the inherent ennui of this course. Another thing is, I'm a very introverted person but she just loved seeing us talking so I had to pretend to be an extrovert and sometimes got drained after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't have much to comment on the grading cuz you know, language stuff can be really subjective, but sometimes I did expect a wee better grade in an area or two.
For your reference:
ST1: Competent, Advanced/Competent, Advanced/Competent
WT: Exceptional/Advanced, Advanced/Competent, Advanced
ST2: Competent, Advanced/Competent
Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: It's not that the workload is huge, but it can be time-consuming and doesn't really worth your time. Like, you need quite some time to do fact and data researching for your writing task. And there are 11 extra materials, which were said to be "extra, but it doesn't mean 'can be ignored' ", as well as an elective. And if you (genuinely) care about your assignments and most importantly, grade, you have to do a bit of prep for your speaking tasks. If I had the choice, I would rather spend my time on physics and maths.

reviews.author: depressedcubic
reviews.title: If ust cancel a Eng lang for us next sem then I would be rly happy
reviews.comment_content: The whole course basically a reminder for ur English skills in high school, I guess it is non trivial but still rly boring.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice instructor, teaching is nice and many activity in lesson to help us complete assignment. also willing to help students, tho can't help the fact that this course content is so shit.
Also he can rmb all student by name and thus mark attendance almost invisibly
reviews.comment_grading: Seems this sem not bad??? My friend got B+ and I got B despite fucking up my second speaking task. Gonna rate the grading as b cuz I got a B
reviews.comment_workload:
Practically non existent except when hv deadline, first speaking task is a group discussion with a bit of monologue(kind of like dse eng paper 4) so is ez to prepare for, writing task hv many lesson to help u finish so if u do along shouldn't take too long to finish, I deadline fighted also not very hard, speaking task 2 is a speech which I prepared for poorly, tho our instructor also hv prep quite a bit lesson time for us to prep this task so I guess if u not lazy ass like me then should be ok.

Btw it seems that next sem will cancel one eng lang for all of us so I guess I am lucky to have taken the less insufferable course.

reviews.author: Ustspacewoman
reviews.title: Emmmmmm
reviews.comment_content:
Same as other classes
The schedule of the class is fair
If you go through all the ppt, I am sure you will learn a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I love Thomas!
For people love talking like me will definitely enjoy his class.
Every class he told us to do free talking about the topic he raised, and every 2 people would repeat what the other had said.
He encouraged everyone to answer the questions in class and has a really great atmosphere.
And he will reply your email in detail and answer your questions quite in time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Well….the overall grade hasn’t been released yet.
But I will show you my score in each task

ST1 advanced advanced/competent(IN) advanced
WT advanced advanced advanced
ST2 Exceptional/advanced Exceptional(CO)

The overall score is 85.5/100(according to the percentage)

I have to say the scores are relatively fair, and the increase of my score is from the professor’s comments on my former task.

Final grade A
reviews.comment_workload:
2 speaking ( one discussion and 1speech)
1 800 essay
4 SDL task
1 reflective task

I don’t think workload matters, because it is a compulsory class. 1403&1404 has bigger workload.

reviews.author: thomas0116
reviews.title: A General Review
reviews.comment_content: This is the most boring part of the whole review. It's just some basic group discussion, public speech and essay's writing skills. I personally think the essay's writing skills is the most practical topic in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nothing to say much here. All I can say is it really depends on the instructor. Some are pretty chill and some are pretty strict. I personally perfer a much chiller instructor for this minor course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading, like teaching, really depends on the instructor and the department that second handedly marking your grade.

However, I think it is important to know the "grand theme" of the topics and what they want you to archive in the assessments.

***It is important to note that the grading will change every term/year.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is manageable. My suggestions is to start/prepare all the assessments and tasks as soon as possible. There are 3 assessments, 4 SDL (Self-Directed Learning) Task, a online SDL elective task and reflective task at the end of the course. A little more info for the SDL tasks, they are basically classwork/homework for you to prepare each upcoming assessment in this course. They are given to you before each assessment.

4 SDL Task - 12%
SDL Elective - 3%
(Above both graded on completion)

Speaking Assessment #1 (In-class) - 25%
- Individual monologue
- Group discussion

Writing Assessment - 35%
- 800 words short essay writing

Speaking Task #2 (In-class) - 20%
- Delivering public speech

Reflective Task - 5%
- 300 to 400 word reflection of this course

That's pretty much it ;)

reviews.author: balance_potato1
reviews.title: Inefficient course that yields very little beneficial outcome
reviews.comment_content: In light of its dearth of any utilitarian merit, Lang 1402 evinces itself as a nugatory and inefficacious enterprise in conferring any propitious consequence to the partakers, who subsequently incur a state of paucity of any corporeal boon or edge that could alternatively be procured from a more serviceable and germane curriculum of learning.
reviews.comment_teaching: The tutelage is excessively lugubrious, the tutor is bereft of English adroitness, for example, the articulation of the multitudinous is habitually confounded to be recognized by the tutor.
reviews.comment_grading:
The evaluative estimation of your linguistic performance is exceedingly substandard and the numerical representation of your proficiency does not correspond to your English aptitude.

My grade for your reference:
Speaking Task 1: Advanced Advanced Advanced
Writing Task 1: Advanced Advanced Advanced
Speaking Task 2: Exceptional/Advanced Advanced
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: The burden is tolerable, one is necessitated to allocate approximately 10 hours on all the undertakings and tasks. However, if a superior grade is coveted to be procured by one, that span might have to be magnified by one to ameliorate the upshot.

reviews.author: OolongTesla
reviews.comment_content:
wk6 : speaking task 1
wk12 : speaking task 2
b4 24 Nov : writing task
b4 10 Nov : SDL task
b4 1 Dec : reflective task

1. Academic Writing Task 1 - Paragraph on the future
Weighting: 5%
2. Academic Speaking Task 1 - Discussion Skills Assessment
Weighting: 25%
3. Academic Writing Task 2 - Summarising Different Perspectives - Short Essay
Weighting: 30%
4. Academic Speaking Task 2 - Summarising Different Perspectives - Short Speech
Weighting: 20%
5. Self Directed Learning (SDL) - Electives and Out of class work AND Reflective Tasks
Weighting: 20%

Overall, the couse syllbus doesnt help you for getting a high grade. Self-confidence and your speaking skills are quite important.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nothing to blame
I love my teacher a lot.
He gave us a lot of life experience and encouraged us to discuss it in the classroom.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading has not been released.

Most of my tasks are competent, and a few are advanced.
reviews.comment_workload: Prepare earlier to handle your assessments.

reviews.author: chromylchloride
reviews.title: pain and suffering
reviews.comment_content:
Don't even bother, I have no comment. I could write a long rant about how shitty this course is, instead, thinking about this course already makes me more depressed

Use ChatGPT as much as you can, don't waste your time on this course, put efforts on other courses instead, even MATH1013 is more enjoyable than this crap

I repeat DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME ON THIS COURSE
reviews.comment_teaching: She skipped bunch of bullshits in the course, makes the course bit more tolerable
reviews.comment_grading:
It's a LANG course, what did you expect, doesn't matter anyway my English sucks. Thank you CLE, more like CLS, fuck off.

Speaking Task 1 - 25%
Speaking Task 2 - 20%
Writing Task - 35%
4 x SDL Tasks - 12%
SDL Elective - 3%
Reflective Task - 5% (why the hell does this exist?)

My results:
ST1: Comp/Emer Comp Comp/Emer
WT1: Adv/Comp Adv Adv
ST2: Comp Adv/Comp
Grade: "I caught a sea bass! No, wait—it's at least a C+!" - Animal Crossing: New Horizons
hahahah C+ lololollool can you believe it FUCKKKKKKKKK
reviews.comment_workload:
Bunch of time wasters erughghhghhghfhghghfsfjlskFUCK

2 Speaking Task, 1st one is group discussion+1:30 minutes speech, 2nd one is 3 minutes speech

1 Writing Task, 800 words academic essay about future global issues

4 SDL Tasks:
1. Group discussion recording
2. Submit a body paragraph
3. Submit a revised body paragraph using feedback from ChatGPT
4. Submit an essay outline generated by ChatGPT

Electives:
Just do Elective 3, you only need to do MC and matchings. Avoid other electives
Elective E1 - Improving pronunciation
Elective E2 - Expanding vocabulary
Elective E3 - Organizing paragraphs
Elective E4 - Developing confidence in speaking at university

Reflective Task:
300-400 words reflection with evidence and examples oh god why why why why stop the suffering already helpppp

reviews.author: sammadman
reviews.comment_content:
a rather simple course that teachs to some basic like APA7 how to properly discuss with each other.
BTW Attendance is recorde, but i highly doubt if it will afffect the final result. <some said that 80% attendance is required, but the teacher just reply us "i am not sure">
u must take it anyway unless your english is so good that BBC invite u on a talkshow.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Venus is a very nice teacher. She uses some class activities to help us talking with each others. At the same time, she is willing to give advices and ideas , if u are stuck.
Hey , u can even talk with her after school
reviews.comment_grading: not yet know yet
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is ok ,  two Speaking tasks (25%+20%)<-- not hard if u didnt aim for A+
800 words essay(25%)<--not hard if u have friends that is native speaker
SDL tasks(15% in total)<-- READ EVERY CONTENT BEFORE DOING, SOME OF THEM IS mUCH MUCH EASIER than other
Reflective Task (5%)<-- i think chatgpt is good enough with your own ideas
1 GenAI Literacy Module<-- a waste of time

reviews.author: bch431
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1 – Language and Learning at University
Unit 2 – Exploring the future (ST1,SDL1)
Unit 3 - Exploring future problems and solutions  (ST2,WT,SDL2)

It can be quite boring, but it depends on your instructor. I've heard from my friends that their courses are interesting and relaxed. You can have chill discussions with the instructor or friends about the topic or whatever you want instead of just focusing on finishing tasks.

so you can skip all the classes and still get a 'good' grade if your English is good.
reviews.comment_teaching: nothing to say, boring zzz
reviews.comment_grading:
ST1 (25%) me: 9/15
WT (35%) me: 11/15
ST2 (20%) me: 7.5/10
SDL(20%) given by completion me: 15/20

Speaking Task are graded by Writing Language, Coherence and Substances.
reviews.comment_workload: not very heavy, it won't take you much time. I put around 2 hour for each assignment.

reviews.author: samson1
reviews.comment_content:
If you want to learn more English, you have come to the wrong place.

This course mostly focuses on writing and speaking.
reviews.comment_teaching: Decent. Limited by the lack of content.
reviews.comment_grading:
Depended on your English level before you take this course.
If you are a native speaker or good at speaking and writing, good grade for you. If not, good luck and hope for B range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Small for a 3 credit course, the amount of content is not great.

Assignment:
Speaking Task 1 (Early-Mid of Sem)
Writing Task 1 (Late Sem)
Speaking Task 2 (Late Sem)
SDL Take (Graded on Completion)

reviews.author: Hanthebot
reviews.title: Chilling course, but better skip it with IELTS/TOEFL
reviews.comment_content:
Unit 1 – Language and Learning at University  (chilling intro, no )
Unit 2 – Exploring the future (~up to midterm, ST1)
Unit 3 - Exploring future problems and solutions  (ST2,WT)

Basically how to talk, present, and write academically - but for beginners. I do not think this course is really needed. If you are eager to learn and can chat with/email professors in English, you are wasting your 3 credit here.

Bit too cringe how the course loves GenAI

Many of the students taking this do not have high English skills.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor was nice, friendly, and loves music. Native English speaker from UK.
He uploaded everything on Canvas.
Just like other instructors, you can ask for consultation before speaking task / writing task.

Also, as the class is pretty small (around 20), it'll be a nice class to make friends, especially from different schools -SBM, SENG, SSCI, maybe SHSS
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: 0%
- but recorded, I heard
Speaking task 1: 25%
- topic discussion, consisted of individual presentation & group discussion
Speaking task 2: 20%
- 2.5~3 min presentation on future problem, highly related to WT
Writing task: 35%
- <800 word essay on a future problem

4 Self-directed learnings: 12%
- using ChatGPT to evaluate your writing, peer review on another group discussion, etc. Graded on completion

SDL elective: 3%
- most of them needs iLang consultation. Elective 3 didn't require it, and therefore I did that. Graded on completion

Reflective task: 5%
- 3-400 word reflection, with criteria provided. Graded on completion.

Most grades are not released. And they (actually only ST1) are released in Exceptional/ Advanced/ Competent/ Emerging. Not in numbers.

I thought I did fine, but got a C+ :p
reviews.comment_workload:
In-class: it's chilling & chatting.
For those tasks / SDL: just ok for 3 credit course.

Everything are done before the final break
.
Advantage of this course: you'll be pre-enrolled to 1403 after this, which has much less workload than 1404.

reviews.author: The OMG Guy
reviews.title: 2023-24 Fall
reviews.comment_content:
I think the content is quite boring

Learning Core:
(Language Form and Accuracy) Written Language (WL) and Spoken Language (SL) -
including selecting language appropriate for the audience, context, and purpose;
expressing ideas appropriately with range and complexity in vocabulary and sentence
structures; recognizing errors; proofreading and editing skills; and developing clear
pronunciation.
(Language Meaning) Substance (SU) and Coherence (CO) – including strategies for
elaborating, substantiating, and organizing ideas logically in speaking and writing.
(Language Use) Interaction (IN) – including strategies to keep a discussion going and
move it forwards constructively.
(Lifelong Learning) Being an Effective Learner (EL) – including proactive practices such as
goal setting, identifying language strengths and weaknesses, evaluating learning
strategies and resources, self-reflection, and seeking, giving, and acting on feedback.

Assessment:

Assignment Details Weighting Assessed CAfLs Assessment Times/Due dates
Speaking Task 1 (ST1) Spoken Monologue (1.5min) and Group Discussion (12min or 16min depending on group size) 25% SL, IN Week6-7
Writing Task (WT) Short Essay 35% WL, CO, SU Fri 24 Nov (by 5pm)
Speaking Task 2 (ST2) Short Speech 20% SL, CO Week12-13
SDL Tasks and Activities
(1) 4 x Self Directed Learning Tasks (12%)

(2) 1 x Self Directed Learning Elective (3%)

(3) Reflective Task (RT) - Written (5%)

20% Graded on completion
SDL Tasks (Throughout semester see here)

Elective by Fri 10 Nov

RT by 5pm, Fri 1 Dec
reviews.comment_teaching:
Thomas is a good teacher
he will try his best to interact with us during the classes
reviews.comment_grading:
The essay writing and the speaking task 2 haven't graded yet, but I think I didn't perform well

For the first speaking task grade is quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
High
Those SDL Task require a lot of time to finish
Also the essay and the speaking require a lot of time to prepare and reiew
so actually the real time to prepare for this  course is quite high

reviews.author: SamuelChansc
reviews.comment_content:
如果您在香港中學文憑考試 (HKDSE) 取得 5 級或以上或來自海外，您不需要參加這門課程，因此您不會在這門課程中獲得不好的成績

課程不會像高中一樣強調技能，而是以互動為主
它迫使你在課程中使用 genAI
reviews.comment_teaching: 她利用一些課堂活動，如討論和在白板上集思廣益的寫作想法來幫助我們探索學習英語的不同觀點。她在教英語方面富有同情心。教學比我想像的更有趣。
reviews.comment_grading: 透過評分我們很容易知道哪些地方可以做得更好，哪些地方做得很好，這對於課程和學生來說都是非常重要的。
reviews.comment_workload:
2 個口說任務 (25%+20%)
1 個寫作任務 (25%)
4 個 SDL 任務 + 1 個選修任務（共 15%）
1 個反思任務 (5%)
1 個GenAI 讀寫模組（必須完成）

工作量隨著你的增加而減少可以使用 Chatgpt 來幫助您（某些任務會要求您使用 Chatgpt 來完成）。但你必須進行校對。
有一些課前材料您應該在上課前閱讀，但如果您不這樣做也沒關係。你仍然能夠跟上，因為這些只是高中材料。

reviews.author: It's time
reviews.title: A course which lacks content.
reviews.comment_content:
Attendance is recorded but not include in grading. The things learnt in the course have no great difference with high school English lessons. Some new things would be the introduction of writing a thesis statement and APA citation. Almost everyone has to take this course, except for the ones who perform good enough in DSE to transfer your credit. In other words, you don't have the option of not studying this course.
I wouldn't regard this course as something useless. It does include some practical task like group discussions (in lesson + speaking task) and presentations (speaking task), which you definitely need the skills in the near future. The elective is said to provide you some ways to improve your skills in different aspect. Nonetheless, the materials they provide are outdated or impractical (they provide some website which you can tell they are lack of maintenance).

The content is lacking and definitely need some revamping, but you still have to take this course
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is great, though I don't like the peer discussion part (which she requires us to have almost in every lesson).
reviews.comment_grading: I wouldn't blame much on the grading as I am not good at English. It varies among the instructors.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 Speaking Task (25%+20%)
1 Writing Task (25%)
4 SDL Task + 1 Elective (15% in total)
1 Reflective Task (5%)
1 GenAI Literacy Module (Must complete)

The workload has reduced as you could use Chatgpt to help you (some tasks would ask you to complete it using Chatgpt). But you have to do the proofreading.
There are some pre-lesson materials that you should read before lessons but it is fine if you don't do so. You are still able to catch up as those are just high school materials.

reviews.author: lllingro
reviews.title: NO MORE FREAKING LANG1402
reviews.comment_content:
If you get level 5 or above in HKDSE or come from overseas
congratulation!!!
you won't need to take this course so you won't get a BAD grade in this course
reviews.comment_teaching:
teachers are quite good.
Especially she uses some class activities to help us talking with each others.Sometimes she will interact with us by chatting.The teaching is more interesting than my expectation.

Yet,it is hard for every LANG1402 teacher to give a good grade.So don't expect you will get a A/B grade in this course.

(Actually you can chat with teacher more often in order to give a good impression.They might give you a better grade?maybe?)
reviews.comment_grading:
Very Good Grade!!!
teacher had told us,'The average grade in our course is C.'
WOW
C = 2
how come you can enroll CPEG OR CS if your english ability is so so.
reviews.comment_workload:
There's a number of homeworks that you need to do if you attend this course in semester
Preparing for two Speaking tasks
which are group discussion and speech
Moreover,you need to write 800 words essay and do SDL tasks
,which has four different modules.
So,you assume that you need to do a LANG1402 homework each weeks.

reviews.author: 命運無常
reviews.title: LANG 1402 = MOTHER F*CKER with unclear grading system
reviews.comment_content:
This course focuses on writing and speaking. The instructor teaches some techniques in using English in writing and speaking.

Most skills either have been learned in secondary school or are just common sense, such as paragraphing, paraphrasing, exploring different perspectives in writing.

The new skills are only how to write a thesis statement and introduction of an academic essay. Although I like one part that emphasizes the importance of interactions in speaking, the content can be much more useful if it includes some useful academic word phrases, a logical approach in constructing convincing paragraphs and some other things we haven't learned in secondary school.

Here is the content of this course:

Unit 1 - Language and Learning at University
L1 Course Introduction
L2 Learning at university
L3 Language learning at university
L4 Using appropriate language style

Unit 2 - Exploring the future (Speaking)
L1-L2 Academic discussions
L3 Practicing academic discussions (Practice with groupmates outside classroom - SDL Task 1)
L4-L5 Developing ideas and perspectives
L6 Feedback giving and Participating in academic discussions

----- Consultations -----
----- Speaking Task 1 -----

Unit 3 - Exploring future problems and solutions (Writing for L1-L7; Speaking for L8-L9)
L1 Exploring different problems
L2 Paragraph development
L3 Substance through paraphrasing and summaries
L4-5 Producing coherent texts
L5-L7 Using appropriate language and style
L8 Preparing and organising a speech
----- Writing Task (Submitted in Canvas) -----
L9 Using voice to engage an audience

----- Consultations -----
----- Speaking Task 2 -----
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would give A-.

She uses some class activities like discussions and brainstorming writing ideas on whiteboards to help us explore different perspectives in learning English. She is also willing answer our questions during spare time in class or after claas, and her responses are generally useful. Her comments on assessments are short but clear enough. She is compassionate in teaching English, so her teaching is much more interesting than I expected and I find out English is more interesting than I thought.

However, restricted by the quality of content, she doesn't teach really solid techniques to help us improve our university English, such as good steps in writing a body paragraph and how to organize solid content in academic discussions.

BTW attendance is recorded but not counted in your grade, but I suggest you go to lessons even if you don't like this course as the instructors may have bad impressions on you and you won't even get C (?).
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading: D
WTF initially, but finally marginally acceptable (??)

Assessments:
1. Speaking Task 1 (25%): 1 minute monologue on your chosen topic about a future idea or issue and why you think it is important for the world in the next 30-50 years, then 12 minutes (3 people) / 16 minutes (4 people) academic discussions sharing your ideas and research about the future

2. Writing Task (35%): About 800 words academic essay on the most urgent problems of your chosen topic about the future

3. Speaking Task 2 (20%) : 3 minutes short speech on the most urgent problem and possible solutions of your chosen topic about the future

4. SDL Tasks (12%):
1) Task 1 - Upload a link to your recorded group discussion
2) Task 2 - Submit a body paragraph (from in class writing) with feedback from ChatGPT (Before U3L3)
3) Task 3 - Submit a revised body paragraph using feedback from SDL Task 2 and highlight changes (Before U3L5)
4) Task 4 - Submit an essay outline generated by ChatGPT with your own annotations critiquing the outline (Before U3L7)

5. Elective (3%): Complete 1 out of 4 electives
1) Improving pronunciation
2) Expanding vocabulary
3) Organizing paragraphs
4) Developing confidence in speaking at university

6. Reflective Task (5%): 300-400 essay reflecting your learning on different areas (grade on completion only)

My result:
ST1: Competent X3 (9/15)
WT: Advanced (WL), Competent X2 (SU, CO) (10/15)
ST2: Competent (SL), Advanced / Competent (CO) (6.5/10)
SDL tasks and elective: Full marks

Estimated score: 68%

Grade: B (I thought I will get C+, so I am pretty surprised with my grade)

The grading system is really non-functional. Although there are 8 levels in the assessment descriptors, most students would be given 'Competent' no matter how much effort you have put. For example, I have put 5 hours into writing the script for ST1 and 3 hours in practicing the monologue, but the result is only 'Competent, Competent, Competent'! I have tried my best to follow her guidelines, including using the phrases recommended, and using strategies taught in lessons ... but it doesn't work!

For ST2 and WT, I have only put in 3 hours for preparing each assessment, but ironically, my result is even better! (at least seeing 'Advanced' finally) (Maybe because I try to impress her so she gives me an 'Advanced'?)

Conclusion: the grading is 'MOTHER F*CKER'. Most normal students would get 'competent' in ALL assessments. You should be thankful if your teacher gives you 'Advanced'. It is fortunate for me to already have a major in year 1 so it won't cause a big problem with studying, but for most year 1 students without a major, this course is a NIGHTMARE and KILLER to students' GPA.

Edit after grade released:
I give grading D but not E because I can get B even I have only got 'Advanced' for 1 time. According to previous reviews, I should get C/C+ with such performance. I think impression counts significantly on your grade, so your destiny mainly depends on your instructor?

FYI LV.5 in both DSE 2023 Paper 2 (Writing) and Paper 4 (Speaking)
reviews.comment_workload:
I would give D+.

Usually you need to do some tasks or read some learning materials before attending the class. They take up some time to finish. If you really forget to do, it doesn't affect your studying.

The workload is pretty high because each assessment and SDL takes much time to prepare, such as finding information on your chosen topics, using ChatGPT several times to complete tasks with comments on the work done by ChatGPT and preparing the speaking task in 2 weeks while taking away your precious time for studying mid-terms and final exams of other more useful courses.

The only good news is that it is very easy to get full marks in SDL tasks, electives and reflective task, but it still takes you at least 30-40 minutes to finish each assignment.

Studying tips:

1. Do elective 3 since it is the only elective without having to seek an academic advisor's advice.

2. Don't spend over 4 hours preparing each assessment. From an economic perspective, the benefit of spending time on getting 'Advanced' or above >> cost of getting 'Advanced' or above. Don't put too much expectation on getting good grade in this course. Then you will feel better when receiving your scores.

3. Actively participate in the lessons. Maybe you can get a better grade because the instructor would have a good impression on you?

4. Citations in body paragraphs count in the word count.

Good luck!

attachments.name: U2L4 SN - Academic discussions - Developing ideas & perspectives
U3L3 - SN - Substance through paraphrasing and summaries

reviews.author: 陳同學
reviews.title: Excellent teaching skills but inflexible policy.
reviews.comment_content:
Although the teaching skills of instructor is excellent, the policy is extremely inflexible.

It forces you to use genAI in the course. It is extremely Inflexible for students who are unwilling to use Al. AI, especially genAI is an extremely controversial topic nowadays. Forcing students to use AI will let the environment of education become worse.

There are also some homework which needs you to book an instructor. However, they won’t mention this earlier. Therefore, when the due date of the homework is near, it actually becomes a ‘disaster’ when I saw this information.(since the information is in the homework but not mentioned before.) The homework allows you to ask the instructor to give advice instead for an advisor. However, I wait for a few days and an instructor still doesn’t respond my email.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching skills of the instructor is excellent. The class is interesting. The instructor will train some junior instructor by giving them more experience too. However, the instructor never responds to the email from student which is an important thing to notice and improve.
reviews.comment_grading: Actually, there is nothing to complain about the grading, since it is easy for us to know where we can do better and where we did good by the gradings which is very important for a course and the student.
reviews.comment_workload: Although the number of homework is acceptable, the inflexibility of course policy greatly increases the workload. Therefore, it is important to improve the flexibility of the policy by not forcing students to use genAI, this will decrease the workload and make the education environment and the course become better.

reviews.author: Supra
reviews.title: LANG1402
reviews.comment_content: Well...The content is rather empty, making one wonder if anything can really be learned from it. The course will not emphasize skills like  in high schools, but mainly interaction
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is approachable and is good at teaching. I think the teacher has a good teaching method and teaching style
reviews.comment_grading: Not good...I haven't had a midterm yet, but judging from the homework, the grade is not very good. (as a poor English speaker)
reviews.comment_workload: As a beginners' language course, the workload is not too large, but rather appropriate.
